headline: Sources and acknowledgments

children.data: Many people contributed their time to explaining their work and the field more broadly. Our heartfelt thanks to everyone who gave their time. In addition to those quoted in the report, we would particularly like to thank:

David Adamson, Rene Almeling, Sarah Armstrong, Jake Anderson, Gina Bartasi, Carlos Calhaz-Jorge, Hung-Chi Chang, Tim Child, Barbara Collura, Tara Comonte, Alan Copperman, Alice Domar, Niamh Dunne-Mason, Silke Dyer, Eric Forman, Randi Goldman, James Grifo, Lorin Gu, Eduardo Hariton, Nicky Hudson, Yu-Ling Huang, Sangita Jindal, Kimura Tadashi, Kishimoto Sachiko, Kuramoto Takeshi, Sebastiaan Mastenbroek, Heidi Mertes, Morimoto Yoshiharu, Alan Murray, Kyle Orwig, Allan Pacey, Dina Radenkovic, Alan Penzias, David Sable, Liz Scheier, Leslie Schrock, Semba Yukari, Amy Speier, Tammy Sun, David Stern, Diane Tober, Ayo Wahlberg, Jack Wilkinson, Chia-Ling Wu, Alice Zheng, Amy Zwanziger, and the teams at HFEA, ESHRE, ICMART and SART.
Some suggested further reading on the subject:
Good practice recommendations for add-ons in reproductive medicine
Cochrane Library review: the effectiveness of IVF add-ons

bodyText:
Many people contributed their time to explaining their work and the field more broadly. Our heartfelt thanks to everyone who gave their time. In addition to those quoted in the report, we would particularly like to thank:
David Adamson, Rene Almeling, Sarah Armstrong, Jake Anderson, Gina Bartasi, Carlos Calhaz-Jorge, Hung-Chi Chang, Tim Child, Barbara Collura, Tara Comonte, Alan Copperman, Alice Domar, Niamh Dunne-Mason, Silke Dyer, Eric Forman, Randi Goldman, James Grifo, Lorin Gu, Eduardo Hariton, Nicky Hudson, Yu-Ling Huang, Sangita Jindal, Kimura Tadashi, Kishimoto Sachiko, Kuramoto Takeshi, Sebastiaan Mastenbroek, Heidi Mertes, Morimoto Yoshiharu, Alan Murray, Kyle Orwig, Allan Pacey, Dina Radenkovic, Alan Penzias, David Sable, Liz Scheier, Leslie Schrock, Semba Yukari, Amy Speier, Tammy Sun, David Stern, Diane Tober, Ayo Wahlberg, Jack Wilkinson, Chia-Ling Wu, Alice Zheng, Amy Zwanziger, and the teams at HFEA, ESHRE, ICMART and SART.
 Some suggested further reading on the subject:
Good practice recommendations for add-ons in reproductive medicine
Cochrane Library review: the effectiveness of IVF add-ons
ART in Europe, 2018
Sex Cells by Rene Almeling
The End of Sex by Henry Greely

parts.headline: The most personal technology
parts.description: Demand for, and expectations of, in vitro fertilisation are growing. The technology is struggling to keep up, write Catherine Brahic and Sacha Nauta

parts.headline: Video: Why we know so little about human reproduction
parts.description: Inside our correspondents’ investigation into the future of fertility

parts.headline: In vitro fertilisation is struggling to keep up with demand
parts.description: Developing the technology to change that is proving a difficult task

parts.headline: IVF remains largely a numbers game
parts.subheadline: If at first you don’t succeed…
parts.description: And plenty of clinics are taking advantage of that

parts.headline: The fertility sector is booming
parts.description: But many women must go abroad to afford treatment: the third article in our special series

parts.headline: Not all types of families can access IVF
parts.description: Some governments are very clear who they want to help

parts.headline: Some women need eggs from others, or from their younger selves
parts.description: Donation and preservation are becoming increasingly widespread

parts.headline: New ways of making babies are on the horizon
parts.description: But it is likely to be a long time before ordinary people can benefit

parts.headline: Lack of basic research has hampered assisted reproduction

_metadata.title: In vitro fertilisation - Sources and acknowledgments | Technology Quarterly | The Economist
_metadata.shareSnippet: In vitro fertilisation – Sources and acknowledgments
_metadata.headline: Sources and acknowledgments
author: The Economist
_metadata.articleBody:
Many people contributed their time to explaining their work and the field more broadly. Our heartfelt thanks to everyone who gave their time. In addition to those quoted in the report, we would particularly like to thank:
David Adamson, Rene Almeling, Sarah Armstrong, Jake Anderson, Gina Bartasi, Carlos Calhaz-Jorge, Hung-Chi Chang, Tim Child, Barbara Collura, Tara Comonte, Alan Copperman, Alice Domar, Niamh Dunne-Mason, Silke Dyer, Eric Forman, Randi Goldman, James Grifo, Lorin Gu, Eduardo Hariton, Nicky Hudson, Yu-Ling Huang, Sangita Jindal, Kimura Tadashi, Kishimoto Sachiko, Kuramoto Takeshi, Sebastiaan Mastenbroek, Heidi Mertes, Morimoto Yoshiharu, Alan Murray, Kyle Orwig, Allan Pacey, Dina Radenkovic, Alan Penzias, David Sable, Liz Scheier, Leslie Schrock, Semba Yukari, Amy Speier, Tammy Sun, David Stern, Diane Tober, Ayo Wahlberg, Jack Wilkinson, Chia-Ling Wu, Alice Zheng, Amy Zwanziger, and the teams at HFEA, ESHRE, ICMART and SART.
 Some suggested further reading on the subject:
Good practice recommendations for add-ons in reproductive medicine
Cochrane Library review: the effectiveness of IVF add-ons
ART in Europe, 2018
Sex Cells by Rene Almeling
The End of Sex by Henry Greely
